verdict.summary: The downloaded module content does not match the checksum recorded in go.sum. This can indicate a corrupted cache, a tampered module, or a module author who re-tagged a release.

dead_ends.action: Set GONOSUMCHECK to skip verification entirely
dead_ends.why_fails: Disables supply chain security â€” allows tampered or malicious modules to be used without detection

dead_ends.action: Manually edit go.sum to replace the hash
dead_ends.why_fails: The checksum database (sum.golang.org) will still reject the mismatch; manual edits create further inconsistencies

workarounds.action: Clean the module cache and re-download

workarounds.condition: when go.sum has stale entries from old module versions

leads_to.condition: when regenerating go.sum misses indirect dependencies

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'checksum mismatch' means the hash doesn't match, while 'missing go.sum entry' means no hash exists yet for the module.
